intro: Hirtella zanzibarica, commonly known as Zanzibar hirtella, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of East Africa, particularly Zanzibar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit, with small, glossy leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in coastal woodlands and shrublands. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
